tier_2_material.accused_details: Amol Ramchandra Pawar, aged about 22 years, residing at Ambilsa Nagar, V.D.Gunjal Chawl, J.H.Road, Mulund (West), Mumbai-400 080

tier_3_contextual.motive: Misbehaving with the victim, possibly indicating personal animosity or intent
tier_3_contextual.circumstances_of_killing: Victim was found with bleeding injuries near her neck and shoulder, lying in a pool of blood and dead in the kitchen
tier_3_contextual.incident_location: RPF Quarters, Building No.34, Block No.21, Station Road, Mulund, Mumbai

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Amol Ramchandra Pawar vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay

residual_details.additional_facts: The accused was convicted by the Additional Sessions Judge, Greater Mumbai in Sessions Case No.720 of 2001. The cause of death was suffocation due to smothering, compression of neck, multiple stab and incised wounds, and multiple burn injuries. The accused was arrested on 05/05/2001 and made a statement leading to the recovery of keys, a T-shirt, jeans, and the sickle.
